explanation: toxdigitvalue is the only direct callee of MHD_strx_to_uint64_. To determine whether MHD_strx_to_uint64_ violates the MISRA rule against direct or indirect recursion we must inspect the implementation of each callee (and their transitive callees) to see if any path returns to MHD_strx_to_uint64_. According to the provided static call graph, toxdigitvalue has no further callees, so obtaining its definition is sufficient to confirm whether any indirect call chain leads back to MHD_strx_to_uint64_. No other symbols (standard macros/types like UINT64_MAX, size_t, uint64_t) affect recursion and therefore are not required for this specific MISRA rule analysis.
